Former Gov: Jeb Bush signed an executive order in 1999 implementing the "One Florida" plan, which banned racial preference in state school admissions.
The: One Florida" plan also created a program guaranteeing that the top 20 percent of high school graduates would gain admission to a post-secondary institution and provided funding for need-based financial aid.
From 1999 to 2013: overall enrollment for black students increased from about 33,000 to almost 44,000, and Hispanic enrollment almost doubled to nearly 80,000.
However: when considering the ratio of black and Hispanic enrollment, black enrollment declined slightly from 14 percent in 1999 to 13 percent in 2013, while Hispanic enrollment increased to nearly 24 percent.
